answers.answer: My ob office won't even discuss induction until a week past due date unless medically necessary . They induced my second daughter ten days after her due date

I was induced but I had developed help which is worse than preeclampsia but I wasn't due for another 2 1/2 months.. It was a little more painful for me cause I got stuck at 4cm for like 2 days . But it wasn't that bad
I'm due the same day. My doctors ask if I want to said I need time to think about it. I'm not in no rush I want to start naturally
My Dr wouldn't induce until at least 41 weeks unless medically necessary! Also not unless you are 1cm dilated at the least...
Just ask it never hurts to have all ur answers!

Definitely wait and do it naturally.  I've heard inductions can take up to 3 days and are very draining.  I was booked in for my induction as over due but thank god she came 2 days before that appointment because it's something I wouldn't want unless actually necessary
Thank you all so much. I would never do anything to hurt my babes. It was just a thought I had, wanted to see some other opinions.

Wait and see what happens;  try and keep active,  u went 11 days over with my first got induced it was ok just didn't like being stuck to the bed but thankfully this time round 2 days before I was booked in for induction she came her self as I didn'twant to go tthrough it again good luck tho x

question: Im due July 31st and was thinking of asking my Dr for and induction on that day if my baby girl hasnt came before. I will be 40 weeks at that time. Has anyone asked for an induction or is it just silly to do so?
title: induction?
